data.name: AvoidAsyncVoidTitle
data.value: Avoid Async Void

data.name: AvoidAsyncVoidDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: AvoidAsyncVoidMessage
data.value: Avoid Async Void

data.name: AsyncMethodNamesShouldEndInAsyncTitle
data.value: Async Method Names Should End in Async

data.name: AsyncMethodNamesShouldEndInAsyncDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: AsyncMethodNamesShouldEndInAsyncMessage
data.value: Async Method Names Should End in Async

data.name: DonTPassAsyncLambdasAsVoidReturningDelegateTypesTitle
data.value: Don't Pass Async Lambdas as Void Returning Delegate Types

data.name: DonTPassAsyncLambdasAsVoidReturningDelegateTypesDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: DonTPassAsyncLambdasAsVoidReturningDelegateTypesMessage
data.value: Don't Pass Async Lambdas as Void Returning Delegate Types

data.name: DonTStoreAsyncLambdasAsVoidReturningDelegateTypesTitle
data.value: Don't Store Async Lambdas as Void Returning Delegate Types

data.name: DonTStoreAsyncLambdasAsVoidReturningDelegateTypesDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: DonTStoreAsyncLambdasAsVoidReturningDelegateTypesMessage
data.value: Don't Store Async Lambdas as Void Returning Delegate Types

data.name: PropagateCancellationTokensWhenPossibleTitle
data.value: Propagate CancellationTokens When Possible

data.name: PropagateCancellationTokensWhenPossibleDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: PropagateCancellationTokensWhenPossibleMessage
data.value: Propagate CancellationTokens When Possible

data.name: DonTMixBlockingAndAsyncTitle
data.value: Don't Mix Blocking and Async

data.name: DonTMixBlockingAndAsyncDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: DonTMixBlockingAndAsyncMessage
data.value: Don't Mix Blocking and Async

data.name: TypesThatOwnDisposableFieldsShouldBeDisposableTitle
data.value: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable

data.name: TypesThatOwnDisposableFieldsShouldBeDisposableDescription
data.value: A class declares and implements an instance field that is a System.IDisposable type, and the class does not implement IDisposable. A class that declares an IDisposable field indirectly owns an unmanaged resource and should implement the IDisposable interface.

data.name: TypesThatOwnDisposableFieldsShouldBeDisposableMessageDependsOnFix
data.value: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

data.name: TypesThatOwnDisposableFieldsShouldBeDisposableMessageNonBreaking
data.value: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.

data.name: UseGenericEventHandlerInstancesTitle
data.value: Use generic event handler instances

data.name: UseGenericEventHandlerInstancesDescription
data.value: A type contains a delegate that returns void, whose signature contains two parameters (the first an object and the second a type that is assignable to EventArgs), and the containing assembly targets Microsoft .NET Framework?2.0.

data.name: UseGenericEventHandlerInstancesMessageVB
data.value: Visual Basic generates EventHandler delegates for events that use the following pattern: Event MyEvent(ByVal Sender As Object, ByVal e as MyEventArgs). Change the event that defines EventHandler {0} to use EventHandler<T> by defining the event type explicitly, e.g. Event MyEvent As EventHandler(Of MyEventArgs).

data.name: UseGenericEventHandlerInstancesMessageDefault
data.value: Remove {0} and replace its usage with EventHandler<T>

data.name: EnumsShouldHaveZeroValueTitle
data.value: Enums should have zero value

data.name: EnumsShouldHaveZeroValueDescription
data.value: The default value of an uninitialized enumeration, just as other value types, is zero. A nonflags-attributed enumeration should define a member by using the value of zero so that the default value is a valid value of the enumeration. If an enumeration that has the FlagsAttribute attribute applied defines a zero-valued member, its name should be ""None"" to indicate that no values have been set in the enumeration.

data.name: EnumsShouldHaveZeroValueMessageFlagsRename
data.value: In enum {0}, change the name of {1} to 'None'.

data.name: EnumsShouldHaveZeroValueMessageFlagsMultipleZeros
data.value: Remove all members that have the value zero from {0} except for one member that is named 'None'.

data.name: EnumsShouldHaveZeroValueMessageNotFlagsNoZeroValue
data.value: Add a member to {0} that has a value of zero with a suggested name of 'None'.

data.name: AbstractTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsTitle
data.value: Abstract types should not have constructors

data.name: AbstractTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsDescription
data.value: Constructors on abstract types can be called only by derived types. Because public constructors create instances of a type, and you cannot create instances of an abstract type, an abstract type that has a public constructor is incorrectly designed.

data.name: AbstractTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsMessage
data.value: Abstract types should not have constructors

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithClsCompliantTitle
data.value: Mark assemblies with CLSCompliant

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithClsCompliantDescription
data.value: The Common Language Specification (CLS) defines naming restrictions, data types, and rules to which assemblies must conform if they will be used across programming languages. Good design dictates that all assemblies explicitly indicate CLS compliance by using CLSCompliantAttribute . If this attribute is not present on an assembly, the assembly is not compliant.

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithClsCompliantMessage
data.value: Mark assemblies with CLSCompliant

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithAssemblyVersionTitle
data.value: Mark assemblies with assembly version

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithAssemblyVersionDescription
data.value: The .NET Framework uses the version number to uniquely identify an assembly, and to bind to types in strongly named assemblies. The version number is used together with version and publisher policy. By default, applications run only with the assembly version with which they were built.

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithAssemblyVersionMessage
data.value: Mark assemblies with assembly version

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithComVisibleTitle
data.value: Mark assemblies with ComVisible

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithComVisibleDescription
data.value: ComVisibleAttribute determines how COM clients access managed code. Good design dictates that assemblies explicitly indicate COM visibility. COM visibility can be set for the whole assembly and then overridden for individual types and type members. If this attribute is not present, the contents of the assembly are visible to COM clients.

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithComVisibleMessageNoAttribute
data.value: Because {0} exposes externally visible types, mark it with ComVisible(false) at the assembly level and then mark all types within the assembly that should be exposed to COM clients with ComVisible(true).

data.name: MarkAssembliesWithComVisibleMessageAttributeTrue
data.value: Consider changing the ComVisible attribute on {0} to false, and opting in at the type level.

data.name: MarkAttributesWithAttributeUsageTitle
data.value: Mark attributes with AttributeUsageAttribute

data.name: MarkAttributesWithAttributeUsageDescription
data.value: When you define a custom attribute, mark it by using AttributeUsageAttribute to indicate where in the source code the custom attribute can be applied. The meaning and intended usage of an attribute will determine its valid locations in code.

data.name: MarkAttributesWithAttributeUsageMessageDefault
data.value: Specify AttributeUsage on {0}.

data.name: MarkAttributesWithAttributeUsageMessageInherited
data.value: Even though attribute {0} inherits AttributeUsage from its base type, you should consider explicitly specifying AttributeUsage on the type to improve code readability and documentation.

data.name: DefineAccessorsForAttributeArgumentsTitle
data.value: Define accessors for attribute arguments

data.name: DefineAccessorsForAttributeArgumentsDescription
data.value: Attributes can define mandatory arguments that must be specified when you apply the attribute to a target. These are also known as positional arguments because they are supplied to attribute constructors as positional parameters. For every mandatory argument, the attribute should also provide a corresponding read-only property so that the value of the argument can be retrieved at execution time. Attributes can also define optional arguments, which are also known as named arguments. These arguments are supplied to attribute constructors by name and should have a corresponding read/write property.

data.name: DefineAccessorsForAttributeArgumentsMessageDefault
data.value: Add a public read-only property accessor for positional argument {0} of Attribute {1}.

data.name: DefineAccessorsForAttributeArgumentsMessageRemoveSetter
data.value: Remove the property setter from {0} or reduce its accessibility because it corresponds to positional argument {1}.

data.name: DefineAccessorsForAttributeArgumentsMessageIncreaseVisibility
data.value: If {0} is the property accessor for positional argument {1}, make it public.

data.name: UsePropertiesWhereAppropriateTitle
data.value: Use properties where appropriate

data.name: UsePropertiesWhereAppropriateDescription
data.value: A public or protected method has a name that starts with ""Get"", takes no parameters, and returns a value that is not an array. The method might be a good candidate to become a property.

data.name: UsePropertiesWhereAppropriateMessage
data.value: Use properties where appropriate

data.name: MarkEnumsWithFlagsTitle
data.value: Mark enums with FlagsAttribute

data.name: MarkEnumsWithFlagsDescription
data.value: An enumeration is a value type that defines a set of related named constants. Apply FlagsAttribute to an enumeration when its named constants can be meaningfully combined.

data.name: MarkEnumsWithFlagsMessage
data.value: Mark enums with FlagsAttribute

data.name: InterfaceMethodsShouldBeCallableByChildTypesTitle
data.value: Interface methods should be callable by child types

data.name: InterfaceMethodsShouldBeCallableByChildTypesDescription
data.value: An unsealed externally visible type provides an explicit method implementation of a public interface and does not provide an alternative externally visible method that has the same name.

data.name: InterfaceMethodsShouldBeCallableByChildTypesMessage
data.value: Interface methods should be callable by child types

data.name: OverrideMethodsOnComparableTypesTitle
data.value: Override methods on comparable types

data.name: OverrideMethodsOnComparableTypesDescription
data.value: A public or protected type implements the System.IComparable interface. It does not override Object.Equals nor does it overload the language-specific operator for equality, inequality, less than, or greater than.

data.name: OverrideMethodsOnComparableTypesMessageEquals
data.value: {0} should override Equals since it implements IComparable.

data.name: OverrideMethodsOnComparableTypesMessageOperator
data.value: {0} should define operator '{1}' since it implements IComparable.

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldBeSealedTitle
data.value: Static holder types should be sealed

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldBeSealedDescription
data.value: A public or protected type contains only static members and is not declared by using the sealed (C# Reference) (NotInheritable) modifier. A type that is not meant to be inherited should be marked by using the sealed modifier to prevent its use as a base type.

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldBeSealedMessageDefault
data.value: Because type {0} contains only 'static' ('Shared' in Visual Basic) members, mark it as 'sealed' ('NotInheritable' in Visual Basic) to prevent consumers from inheriting from it.

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldBeSealedMessageCSharp20
data.value: Because type {0} contains only 'static' members, mark it as 'static' to prevent consumers from inheriting from it.

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsTitle
data.value: Static holder types should not have constructors

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsDescription
data.value: A public or nested public type declares only static members and has a public or protected default constructor. The constructor is unnecessary because calling static members does not require an instance of the type. The string overload should call the uniform resource identifier (URI) overload by using the string argument for safety and security.

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsMessageDefault
data.value: Because type {0} contains only 'static' ('Shared' in Visual Basic) members, add a default private constructor to prevent the compiler from adding a default public constructor.

data.name: StaticHolderTypesShouldNotHaveConstructorsMessageCSharp20
data.value: Because type {0} contains only 'static' members, mark it as 'static' to prevent the compiler from adding a default public constructor.

data.name: MovePInvokesToNativeMethodsClassTitle
data.value: Move pinvokes to native methods class

data.name: MovePInvokesToNativeMethodsClassDescription
data.value: Platform Invocation methods, such as those that are marked by using the System.Runtime.InteropServices.DllImportAttribute attribute, or methods that are defined by using the Declare keyword in Visual Basic, access unmanaged code. These methods should be of the NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods class.

data.name: MovePInvokesToNativeMethodsClassMessage
data.value: Move pinvokes to native methods class

data.name: IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseTitle
data.value: Identifiers should differ by more than case

data.name: IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseDescription
data.value: Identifiers for namespaces, types, members, and parameters cannot differ only by case because languages that target the common language runtime are not required to be case-sensitive.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseMessageMember
data.value: Change member names {0} and '{1}' so that they differ by more than case.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseMessageType
data.value: Change type names {0} and '{1}' so that they differ by more than case.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseMessageNamespace
data.value: Change namespace names {0} and '{1}' so that they differ by more than case.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldDifferByMoreThanCaseMessageParameter
data.value: Change parameter names {0} and '{1}' so that they differ by more than case.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldHaveCorrectPrefixTitle
data.value: Identifiers should have correct prefix

data.name: IdentifiersShouldHaveCorrectPrefixDescription
data.value: The name of an externally visible interface does not start with an uppercase ""I"". The name of a generic type parameter on an externally visible type or method does not start with an uppercase ""T"".

data.name: IdentifiersShouldHaveCorrectPrefixMessageInterface
data.value: Prefix interface name {0} with 'I'.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldHaveCorrectPrefixMessageTypeTypeParameter
data.value: On type {0}, prefix generic type parameter name {1} with 'T'.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldHaveCorrectPrefixMessageMethodTypeParameter
data.value: On method {0}, prefix generic type parameter name {1} with 'T'.

data.name: NonConstantFieldsShouldNotBeVisibleTitle
data.value: Non-constant fields should not be visible

data.name: NonConstantFieldsShouldNotBeVisibleDescription
data.value: Static fields that are neither constants nor read-only are not thread-safe. Access to such a field must be carefully controlled and requires advanced programming techniques to synchronize access to the class object.

data.name: NonConstantFieldsShouldNotBeVisibleMessage
data.value: Non-constant fields should not be visible

data.name: DoNotMarkEnumsWithFlagsTitle
data.value: Do not mark enums with FlagsAttribute

data.name: DoNotMarkEnumsWithFlagsDescription
data.value: An externally visible enumeration is marked by using FlagsAttribute, and it has one or more values that are not powers of two or a combination of the other defined values on the enumeration.

data.name: DoNotMarkEnumsWithFlagsMessage
data.value: Do not mark enums with FlagsAttribute

data.name: DoNotDecreaseInheritedMemberVisibilityTitle
data.value: Do not decrease inherited member visibility

data.name: DoNotDecreaseInheritedMemberVisibilityDescription
data.value: You should not change the access modifier for inherited members. Changing an inherited member to private does not prevent callers from accessing the base class implementation of the method.

data.name: DoNotDecreaseInheritedMemberVisibilityMessage
data.value: Do not decrease inherited member visibility

data.name: OperatorOverloadsHaveNamedAlternatesTitle
data.value: Operator overloads have named alternates

data.name: OperatorOverloadsHaveNamedAlternatesDescription
data.value: An operator overload was detected, and the expected named alternative method was not found. The named alternative member provides access to the same functionality as the operator and is provided for developers who program in languages that do not support overloaded operators.

data.name: OperatorOverloadsHaveNamedAlternatesMessageDefault
data.value: Provide a method named '{0}' as a friendly alternate for operator {1}.

data.name: OperatorOverloadsHaveNamedAlternatesMessageProperty
data.value: Provide a property named '{0}' as a friendly alternate for operator {1}.

data.name: OperatorOverloadsHaveNamedAlternatesMessageMultiple
data.value: Provide a method named '{0}' or '{1}' as an alternate for operator {2}.

data.name: OperatorOverloadsHaveNamedAlternatesMessageVisibility
data.value: Mark {0} as public because it is a friendly alternate for operator {1}.

data.name: OperatorsShouldHaveSymmetricalOverloadsTitle
data.value: Operators should have symmetrical overloads

data.name: OperatorsShouldHaveSymmetricalOverloadsDescription
data.value: A type implements the equality or inequality operator and does not implement the opposite operator.

data.name: OperatorsShouldHaveSymmetricalOverloadsMessage
data.value: Operators should have symmetrical overloads

data.name: CollectionPropertiesShouldBeReadOnlyTitle
data.value: Collection properties should be read only

data.name: CollectionPropertiesShouldBeReadOnlyDescription
data.value: A writable collection property allows a user to replace the collection with a different collection. A read-only property stops the collection from being replaced but still allows the individual members to be set.

data.name: CollectionPropertiesShouldBeReadOnlyMessage
data.value: Collection properties should be read only

data.name: OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEqualsTitle
data.value: Overload operator equals on overriding value type Equals

data.name: OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEqualsDescription
data.value: In most programming languages there is no default implementation of the equality operator (==) for value types. If your programming language supports operator overloads, you should consider implementing the equality operator. Its behavior should be identical to that of Equals

data.name: OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEqualsMessage
data.value: Overload operator equals on overriding value type Equals

data.name: PassSystemUriObjectsInsteadOfStringsTitle
data.value: Pass system uri objects instead of strings

data.name: PassSystemUriObjectsInsteadOfStringsDescription
data.value: A call is made to a method that has a string parameter whose name contains "uri", "URI", "urn", "URN", "url", or "URL". The declaring type of the method contains a corresponding method overload that has a System.Uri parameter.

data.name: PassSystemUriObjectsInsteadOfStringsMessage
data.value: Pass system uri objects instead of strings

data.name: ImplementIEquatableWhenOverridingObjectEqualsTitle
data.value: Implement IEquatable when overriding Object.Equals

data.name: ImplementIEquatableWhenOverridingObjectEqualsDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: ImplementIEquatableWhenOverridingObjectEqualsMessage
data.value: Implement IEquatable when overriding Object.Equals

data.name: CancellationTokenParametersMustComeLastTitle
data.value: CancellationToken parameters must come last

data.name: CancellationTokenParametersMustComeLastDescription
data.value: #N/A

data.name: CancellationTokenParametersMustComeLastMessage
data.value: CancellationToken parameters must come last

data.name: ConstructorMakeNoninheritableBaseClassInheritableTitle
data.value: Constructor make noninheritable base class inheritable

data.name: ConstructorMakeNoninheritableBaseClassInheritableDescription
data.value: When a base class is noninheritable because its constructor is internal, a derived class should not make it inheritable by having a public or protected constructor.

data.name: ConstructorMakeNoninheritableBaseClassInheritableMessage
data.value: Constructor make noninheritable base class inheritable

data.name: IdentifiersShouldNotContainTypeNamesTitle
data.value: Identifier contains type name

data.name: IdentifiersShouldNotContainTypeNamesDescription
data.value: Names of parameters and members are better used to communicate their meaning than to describe their type, which is expected to be provided by development tools. For names of members, if a data type name must be used, use a language-independent name instead of a language-specific one.

data.name: IdentifiersShouldNotContainTypeNamesMessage
data.value: Identifier '{0}' contains type name

data.name: CreatePropertyAccessorForParameter
data.value: Create a property accessor.

data.name: MakeGetterPublic
data.value: Make the getter of the property public

data.name: MakeSetterNonPublic
data.value: Make the setter of the property non-public
